text:
Hey folks, seeing something kinda random that I can’t make heads or tails of. I’ve got a colleague reporting a blank square within an H1 tag when they view a particular page. I can’t reproduce, and searching the web didn’t get me far. However, *I’m seeing it in the page screenshot when I go to “Page Details”*.

Any chance someone’s encountered something like this before?
URL: <https://www.betterup.com/2021bundle>
Page screenshot: <https://cdn2.HubSpot.net/hubshot/21/12/14/28769758-f340-4028-ab42-a399e750cfc2.png>

Hey <@U02NJACH5QS> ! Yes, I’ve run into this; it usually is caused by copy/pasting from Google docs or ms word and the (normally hidden) char is not supported by either the font set or the OS it's being viewed on. I’d suggest using the ‘view source’ tool and replacing with standard characters only.

Interesting. Marks theory there makes sense. The issue feels like what you see when you try to use a glyph in a font that the font doesn’t fully support.

That kinda coincides with what you’d get from Google Docs or another editor’s formatting when copying and pasting.
